dmca.title: [EV1-C1990651Y] FW: Cricket Australia 2006/2007 infringments - CrkAus_NRID14166
dmca.body:
________________________________

From: Mike Kiernan [mailto:MikeK@nr-online.com] 
Sent: Monday, December 04, 2006 4:24 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: RE: [EV1-C1990651Y] FW: Cricket Australia 2006/2007
infringments - CrkAus_NRID14166



Dear Sirs,

I don't understand why the fact that you need to log-in is relavent? I
have clearly provided evidence that the site is offering illegal cricket
streams. Below is a screenshot that again illustrates the copyright
infringment. Again, I also attach a letter of authority from Cricket
Australia. 



As of yet we have had no reply to the Cease and Desist notification sent
to the site owner. The notifications sent to both yourself and the site
owner combined with the above screenshot comply with the warning
notification requirements of the Copyright Act. Accordingly I would
request that you remove the site in question to avoid potential legal
action from our clients Cricket Australia. 
Please let me know how you intend to proceed on this matter,

Regards,

Mike Kiernan 

NetResult

 

 

Mike Kiernan

Account Executive

Projector NetResult Ltd
Mulberry House,
583 Fulham Road,
London,
SW6 5UA 

mikek@nr-online.com <mailto:mikek@nr-online.com> 
http://www.nr-online.com <http://www.nr-online.com/>  

tel: 
  

+44 (0)20 7471 1733
 

 -----Original Message-----
From: Copyright [mailto:Copyright@theplanet.com
<mailto:Copyright@theplanet.com> ]
Sent: 01 December 2006 18:55
To: mikek@nr-online.com
Cc: Theplanet@chillingeffects.org
Subject: FW: [EV1-C1990651Y] FW: Cricket Australia 2006/2007
infringments - CrkAus_NRID14166

 To Whom It May Concern:

The URL in question is currently not accessible as of 12:54:22 p.m.
(GMT-6) on December 1, 2006 because it requires proprietary log-in
information to access it.

Legal Response Team
The Planet/EV1 Internet

MIME element (text/plain)
Dear Sirs,

The site www.waheguruson.com (IP address 209.85.48.4) is streaming the
current Ashes Cricket Series between Australia and England. This
infringes the copyright of our client, Cricket Australia. I attach a
Letter of Authority from Cricket Australia.

My colleague has already sent a Cease & Desist notification to both the
site owner and "ipadmin@ev1servers.net". I enclose a screenshot of the
site clearly streaming the cricket and hence infringing our clients
rights.

Please take action against this site immediately. Please do not hesitate
to ask any further questions that you might have.

Incidentally, the site is also streaming the Pakistan v West Indies
Series, infringing the rights of another client of ours, Echostar
Satellite. I sent a C&D regarding this matter yesterday.

Regards,

Mike Kiernan



NetResult

 

 



Mike Kiernan

Account Executive

-----Original Message-----
From: Tim Cooper [mailto:TimC@nr-online.com <mailto:TimC@nr-online.com>
]
Sent: 27 November 2006 15:04
To: waheguruson@yahoo.com
Cc: ipadmin@ev1servers.net; invfree@nivisionfree.com
Subject: Cricket Australia 2006/2007 infringments - CrkAus_NRID14166
Importance: High
Sensitivity: Confidential


NetResult Internal Reference:  CrkAus_NRID14166

Please quote the above CrkAus_NRID14166 reference in all communications
with us regarding this issue.


Dear Sirs,

We write on behalf of Cricket Australia, in respect of certain
intellectual property rights including Audio Visual content.

We have noticed that your Web Site, http://www.waheguruson.com
<http://www.waheguruson.com>  is
displaying and/or offering Cricket Australia audio visual content. All
copyright in such images vest with Cricket Australia.

As you have neither sought nor obtained permission from Cricket
Australia to use this content, your present use is a clear infringement
of Cricket Australia's rights and patently infringes the copyright held
in that content.  Please be aware that under relevant copyright laws,
the copyright held in a broadcast includes the right to rebroadcast the
broadcast, whether within or outside of Australia.  Any broadcast or
rebroadcast of the content
- including by way of making the broadcast available online - in any
territory in the world is an infringement upon this right unless done so
with Cricket Australia's consent, which has not been provided to you or
in respect of your website.

Please immediately cease all such infringements on any and all of your
web sites and confirm to us via email that you have done so.

Nothing in this letter is intended or shall be construed to constitute
an express or implied waiver of any of Cricket Australia's rights or
remedies, including any rights or remedies in respect of infringement
not explicitly stated, whether current or in the future, all of which
are expressly reserved. 

Formal Declaration

I Tim Cooper, hereby state that Cricket Australia is the owner of the
exclusive rights referenced above and that NetResult is authorised to
act on its behalf with respect to internet monitoring and compliance. On
behalf of Cricket Australia, I hereby state that I have a good faith
belief that use of the content in the manner complained of is not
authorised by Cricket Australia, its agents, or the law.

I, Tim Cooper, as a representative of NetResult hereby digitally sign
this e-mail message under penalty of perjury under the laws of the
United States of America with the additional statement under penalty of
perjury that the information in the notice is accurate.


Yours sincerely,

Tim Cooper


NetResult
A Division of Projector NetResult Ltd
Mulberry House
583 Fulham Road
London
UK SW6 5UA

Tel: +44 (0)20 7471 1730

Head Office: Projector NetResult Ltd, 8 Wye Street, Hereford, UK HR2 7RB


Please note, if this email has been sent to the wrong recipient, please
accept our apologies, inform us of the error, and forward this e-mail
immediately to the correct person or department for action.
